chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin V Pierce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 129 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Commencing forthwith. FIRST 2 Months are Straight Time. NO good time. NEXT 3 Months are with Huber. Release for standard conditions. LAST 7 months are STAYED for use at agent's discretion. 
Huber may be served in Milwaukee County, but No Electronic Monitoring.
To be performed as a condition of probation, as directed by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin V Pierce

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.

Defendant Justin V Pierce in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Brian J. Juech and Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes sentencing recommendations.  Defense makes sentencing recommendations.  Tina Lipski, Mother, makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  The Defendant was given the following:

Count 4

WITHHELD SENTENCE;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 1/2 YEARS; 129- days credit (if revoked);
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
*Perform 40-hours of Community Service

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 - Apply Cash bail - Balance to be refunded to the poster 
DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 -  Apply Cash bail - Balance to be refunded to the poster 

CONDITION TIME: 12 months.
Defendant is to serve the first 2 months JAIL straight time - no good time commencing forthwith.
The next 3 months are to be served with HUBER (with standard release conditions).
The last 7 months are STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.
The Huber sentence may be served in Milwaukee County but no electronic monitoring per this Court.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
